awd_titl_txt: SBIR Phase II:  Soft Foam Polyurethanes from Algae Oil
awd_abstract_narration:
The broader impact/commercial potential of this Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) project is to help address the issue of non-bio degradable plastics polluting the planet through the development of biodegradable urethane monomers, formulations yielding industry standard performance metrics for their application.  There are 2,600 pounds of plastic trash accumulated for each living person today, with at least 18 billion pounds of plastic entering our oceans every year.  Sustainable products have yet to be commercialized at scale due to high cost and low quality.  We will change the urethane industry through the commercialization of high-performance biodegradable materials and development of high value consumer products.

This project proposes to address the lack of biologically based materials in consumer products by utilizing algae polyols, and their formulation chemistries, to develop and optimize appropriate bio-based formulations, specifically polyurethane foams, for consumer use as footwear.  The company will demonstrate biodegradability of the product.  The company will also develop the supply chain and associated processes for their algae raw materials to produce algae polyols at scale.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Technology, Innovation, and Partnerships

por.por_cntn:
Algenesis has completed our NSF SBIR Phase II project: Soft Foam Polyurethanes from Algae Oil. We began this project based on the observations that consumers were demanding environmentally friendly and sustainably sourced polyurethane products, and that there was an opportunity to meet this demand, because the large chemical suppliers were unable or unwilling to develop bio-based polyurethanes that meet specification for the shoe industry. Polyurethanes are used in many products worldwide, including soft polyurethanes foams like those found in shoe midsoles, or even flip flops.  All polyurethanes used today have two major environmental problems, they are derived from petroleum, a finite and energy-intensive resource, and second, they are not biodegradable, meaning that polyurethane products made today will last in the environment for hundreds of years. To address this issue, many companies have elected to use recycled materials in their products, and although a great improvement over virgin plastics, only a few percent of the recyclable plastics are recycled today, and polyurethanes, especially the thermoset polyurethanes used in shoe midsole are not recycled at all.  Rather than focus on recyclable polymers, Algenesis is focused on developing renewable and sustainable bio-based polyurethanes that biodegrade at the end of life, so that we never accumulate plastic waste, no matter how it is disposed of. 

Our Phase II SBIR was aimed at scaling our technology to create a marketable product that is affordable, meets industry standards, and doesn't compromise on sustainability. We've achieved this by developing our unique BlueView Footwear brand that is both sustainable and biodegradable. Our shoes last just as long as ones that are not biodegradable, but once they are placed in a compost pile, they are converted back to basic compounds within six months, simply becoming algae food. (We have a peer-reviewed science paper to prove this!)

The initial BlueView shoe design has a unique brand promise: A sneaker with timeless style and an ocean of comfort that can take you anywhere and leave no trace. Algenesis has already arranged a contract manufacturer to make limited quantities of shoes using our proprietary polyurethane formulation, and are in discussions with some larger manufacturers to make our footwear utilizing our proprietary formulation using standard chemical manufacturing technology.

In addition to developing our own footwear products, as part of Algenesis commitment to a waste free world, we will also license their materials to others to make sure that as many shoes as possible are produced from these biodegradable polyurethanes. We are doing this under the Soleic brand. To validate their claims of durability, manufacturability, and biodegradability, we have engaged several well-known shoe companies.

BlueView shoes will be available in sample quantities in late 2021 and come to market in early 2022 with one style and many colors. We anticipate that eco-aware customers, between 25-45, will be the initial customers and we have formed partnerships with several leading organizations that want to help solve plastic pollution in the ocean.


Last Modified: 12/02/2021
Modified by: Marissa A Tessman
